metadata.title: CVE-2023-6780 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow was found in the __vsyslog_internal function of theglibc library. This function is called by the syslog and vsyslog functions.This issue occurs when these functions are called with a very long message,leading to an incorrect calculation of the buffer size to store themessage, resulting in undefined behavior. This issue affects glibc 2.37 andnewer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6780` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
libc-bin - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
libc6 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
libc6-amd64 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
libc6-i386 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
libc6-prof - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
libc6-s390 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
libc6-x32 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
locales - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
locales-all - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
nscd - 2.35-0ubuntu3.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.35-0ubuntu3.6').
